comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: A survivor of the Titanic.  I assume the girl is her daughter,  Marjorie Charlotte "Lottie" Collyer, who also survived the sinking.  Her husband, Harvey, did not.  They are in the list of Second Class passengers.

comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: As well, the "White Star Line" blanket draped over her knees is the same line that operated the Titanic.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The mother's listing in the Encyclopedia Titanica: www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/titanic-survivor/charlotte-... She died from TB in 1914. Marjorie's listing: www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/titanic-survivor/marjorie-c... She was eight at the time of the Titanic disaster; by 10, she was an orphan, gone to live with a distant uncle. She married in 1927. When she died in 1965, she had been a widow for many years. There's a photo of Marjorie as an adult, at a Titanic anniversary event, here: www.encyclopedia-titanica.org/violets-barren-white-star-w...

comment.author: 33659611@N04
comment._content: Links tell us so much about their difficult life but here - sitting on the porch  - they seem to be so safe. Beautiful photograph.

comment.author: 14343849@N05
comment._content: They do look safe, but the mother has such a pained expression--probably grief for her husband? Amazing story.
